td.style: width: 100%; border-style: none; padding: 10px; text-align: center; font-size: 14px;
td.strong: Reminder: Distance learning begins on Monday, March 30 and will continue through the end of the school year. Detailed information can be found at sowashco.org/distancelearning.

div.p:
South Washington County Schools is a suburban district located southeast of St. Paul, Minnesota. The district includes all or parts of the communities of Cottage Grove, Newport, St. Paul Park, Woodbury, as well as, Afton, Denmark and Grey Cloud Island Townships. District 833 is committed to the mission of "igniting a passion for lifelong learning" through collaboration, continuous improvement, equity, integrity and relationships.
We have 16 elementary schools for students in grades K-5, four middle schools serving grades 6-8, three comprehensive high schools and one alternative high school. There are also a variety of early learning and adult education and enrichment programs offered through Community Education.

a.title: Class of 2020 Senior Spotlight: Hermione Joseph

div.a: Class of 2020 Senior Spotlight: Hermione Joseph
div.div: To help celebrate the Class of 2020, we asked high school principals to identify exemplary seniors to be profiled for our Class of 2020 Senior Spotlight series. Hear from East Ridge High School senior Hermoine Joseph.

a.title: Distance Learning Extended Through the End of the School Year

div.a: Distance Learning Extended Through the End of the School Year
div.div: Today, Governor Tim Walz announced that school buildings will remain closed through the end of the school year.

a.title: Three Senior Student-Athletes Named Athena Award Winners

div.a: Three Senior Student-Athletes Named Athena Award Winners
div.div: South Washington County Schools is excited to announce this years Athena Award winners.
